Hobbes is reimagining how modern SaaS companies demo and educate their customers. Their AI agents act as interactive product experts: they give tailored, live demos to prospects and guide new customers through setup and product education based on their goals, without needing to hand off to human teams. A unified â€œAsk Hobbesâ€ chat highlights how prospects and customers engage, where they get stuck, and where revenue is leaking, helping teams continuously improve activation, expansion, and overall experience. â€œLyra feels less like a vendor and more like an extension of our team. They bring world-class engineering and design talent at the breakneck pace needed for a venture-backed AI startup. Working with them over the past two months has been incredible; their engineers are deeply thoughtful, ramp up super quickly and ship production-quality code + designs. They took us from our early MVP into something that's GTM-ready. Can't recommend working with them enough!â€ - Chirag Kulkarni, CEO of Hobbes. Partnering with Chirag and the Hobbes team has been a genuinely exciting journey. Watching their vision turn into a product that elevates user understanding and onboarding has been inspiring.

I've seen the chatter. Itâ€™s okay. Conversations like this usually come from people who care about the same ecosystem we do. The message I shared recently was meant for founders and builders in Australia. The point wasnâ€™t about working till 11:30pm. It was about ambition and what it takes to close the gap between whatâ€™s possible here and whatâ€™s already happening in the world. Lyra was built for people who want to build. Many of our engineers dream of starting companies, and our role is to create a support system with revenue, environment, and a community so they can pursue these ambitions (with the highest chance of success). I believe drive looks different for everyone. Some want balance, some want to push limits. Both belong here. Im proud of what Lyra's building. From engineers mentoring each other weekly, to clients trusting us with complex products, to side projects turning into startups. Im grateful to everyone whoâ€™s part of this journey. The mission stays the same: build, teach, and grow.

Unstable UI when streaming AI responses? Try this instead. Welcome to Software Sauce - Ep 1, our new series where our very own Lyra engineers break down common tech problems to help you learn, build, and level up. This episode is hosted by our FDE, Eoin Redoblado, who walks through a real client issue we hit: Why does a chat UI fall apart when you rely on XML tags + naive rendering for streamed AI responses? We cover: â†’ Why XML-based streaming leads to layout jumps, lag, and broken components â†’ Why structured JSON chunks are way more stable â†’ How â€œnormalised chat statesâ€ work (position arrays + repositories) â†’ The simple but powerful pattern that makes Claude-style streaming smooth â†’ Real examples of bad vs. good implementations If youâ€™re building AI chat interfaces, this pattern will save you hours of pain + and your frontend will thank you. ğŸ¥ Watch Ep 1: Normalising chat states & Let us know what topic you want us to cover next in Software Sauce ğŸ‘‡ #lyra #sydney #softwaresauce

Lyra is looking to hire 20 software engineers in Melbourne, offering $83kâ€“$166k packages to directly work with silicon valley startups. We are opening a new Melbourne office in early 2026, bringing new culture, new partnerships, and a new community. This is our big step toward investing in Melbourne's incredible talent pool, and we are looking for our first wave of builders to help kickstart this new Lyra branch, and take ownership to drive it into reality, and work alongside 60+ of the smartest people currently at Lyra. $1000 bounty for all referrals. If you or someone you know want to work on meaningful problems with a team that moves fast, shoot me a DM, or look in the comments. This opportunity comes once in a lifetime.

Whether you're training large models or scaling experiments, Thunder Compute makes it seamless, fast, and cost-effective so teams can focus on building, not managing hardware. â€œLyra has become integral to our team, refactoring our frontend, launching a new Go CLI, setting up CI/CD, and improving our workflows. Everything now runs faster, feels more reliable, and is built to scale as we grow. I would highly recommend working with them.â€ - Carl Peterson, Thunder Compute At Lyra, we love tackling problems. Itâ€™s been a pleasure partnering with Carl and Brian Model on Thunder Compute, and we canâ€™t wait to see whatâ€™s ahead for them. Check them out!

What does it take to land your design on the Seattle Times homepage?? Kieu Ngoc Ha / blake did just that leading the design for Mirelle Educationâ€™s new website with the team at Lyra. The goal was to reimagine what college guidance could look and feel like, modern, warm, and genuinely supportive. Mirelle Education is a college admissions mentorship and life coaching practice that helps middle and high school students discover their interests, build meaningful projects and grow into confident independent learners. 97% of their students are admitted to one or more of their top choice colleges. Could not be prouder of Blake and the Lyra team for bringing the vision to life and to see it featured on the Seattle Times homepage is just insane ğŸ™

Iris (YC F25) is a privacy-first personal AI assistant that unifies your tools to manage work and life in one place. It learns your patterns, adapts to priorities, and reduces noise by making smarter decisions about your time. From rescheduling meetings and drafting emails to planning breaks, Iris streamlines the details so you can stay focused, while end-to-end encryption and data controls keep you fully in charge. â€œWe're extremely happy with how our website turned out. The team really picked up the pace in the final stretch and delivered an amazing result. Within first 24h of launch, the site has already received over 200k+ views and a lot of positive feedback. Our original plan was to launch and then iterate, but the current version already feels spot on. It was a real pleasure working with the team!â€œ - Samika Sanghvi At Lyra, we celebrate our clientsâ€™ wins as much as our own. Itâ€™s been a real pleasure working with Samika and Siddhant, and we canâ€™t wait to see what they achieve with Iris! Check them out in the comment!

Sharing the recent web redesign that Lyra has done for Hobbes. Hobbes is an AI copilot that sits inside your product, guiding users in real time and learning from your content to deliver personalized onboarding and support. It deploys in under an hour and helps teams improve adoption, reduce friction, and scale user success. https://hihobbes.com/

We are excited to announce our partnership with UNSW Women in Technology! UNSW Women in Technology (WIT) is a student-run society with a network of over 2000+ members. Alongside other events, UNSW WIT offers an Empowerment Mentoring Program that pairs mentees with experienced industry mentors who provide personalised guidance on starting their professional careers. We are happy to share our partnership with UNSW Artificial Intelligence Society (AISoc)! AISoc is at the forefront of advocating for AI enthusiasts at UNSW by providing a space for individuals to freely explore their passions for AI and how it can be used in innovation. They regularly hold many initiatives, such as 'AICon' - a conference where students are able to showcase their AI projects to industry leaders and representatives. We were grateful to be invited as industry sponsors at AICon 2025! Interested? Reach out to our team or an AISoc executive to find out how we're working together to explore AI's role in shaping innovation.
